gradients.note: Avoid gradients. Use solid, high-contrast colors for precision feel.

specific_instructions_to_main_agent: FORCE DARK MODE: Set the entire app to dark mode by default. The root div should have the 'dark' class.
DENSITY: In the Editor view, use 'dense' spacing. Reduce padding on inputs and buttons to 'p-1' or 'p-2' to mimic Figma/Adobe properties panels.
CANVAS BACKGROUND: Use a dot grid pattern on a dark gray background (#1e1e1e) for the canvas area to give it an engineering feel.
SIDEBAR: collapse the left sidebar to icons only by default to maximize canvas space.
PROPERTY PANEL: Organize into Collapsible Sections (Typography, Layout, Appearance).
TYPOGRAPHY CONTROLS: For the font selector, use a visual preview if possible, but keep the dropdown compact.
ASSET LIBRARY: Use the provided blueprint images as thumbnails in the asset library.
COLOR PICKER: Ensure the color picker component fits within the dark theme (no white borders).
PROJECT CARDS: On the dashboard, use the 'Bento' grid layout. The 'Recent Project' card should be large (col-span-2 or col-span-3).
EMPTY STATES: Use technical/blueprint iconography for empty states, not playful illustrations.
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; }
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations
NEVER use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤– etc.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable (except in the Editor panels where density is key).
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui.
